projects.name: The Guidance Team
projects.description: A full-fledged virtual reality game for Oculus Go and GearVR devices. Created under my own LLC, RGB Schemes. The game is a third person shooter where players progress through levels killing zombies. A pretty straightforwad game.

projects.name: Error
projects.description: A simple WebGL first person shooter using ThreeJS and PhysiJS. The idea behind this was to give users the ability to play entire games inside their web browser natively. Created in less than 24 hours. You can play it in your web browser here.

projects.name: Test Shooter - Unreal Engine
projects.description: Another simple first-person shooter, this time created in the Unreal Engine. This was created in under a week and was simply meant to learn how to use Unreal Engine to create games.

projects.name: Rift Poke
projects.description: A tutorial for Oculus Touch and created under my LLC, RGB Schemes. It is a sample project for how to use Oculus Touch to create virtual hands that can be used in games and applications. The tutorials (Part 1 and Part 2) for this were based on research done by me for implementing these technologies.

projects.name: Vive Toss
projects.description: A sample application for the HTC Vive and created under my LLC, RGB Schemes. It is a sample project for how to use HTC Vive Wands to interact with objects and teleport between locations. The tutorials (Part 1 and Part 2) for this is based of research done by me for implementing these technologies.

projects.name: Moonwalk for Cardboard
projects.description: A simple Android application for Google Cardboard. Users are on the surface of the moon and can look around, as well as view their own personal photos.

projects.name: Nintendo DS Assembly Interpreter
projects.description: A simple assembly interpreter for the Nintendo DS. It can be used to learn the basics of assembly and makes use of the dual-screens of the Nintendo DS to allow debugging at the same time.

projects.name: Kinect for Windows 2.0 Demo
projects.description: This demo allows users to connect a Microsoft Kinect 2.0 sensor to their computer and view various pieces of output for it. Originally written for the alpha product, it should work for the final version as well.

projects.name: MoonWalk Demo
projects.description: A simple virtual reality sample for the Oculus DK1 and original Microsoft Kinect. It allows users to walk around and see their hands in virtual reality, long before the existence of today's hardware.

projects.name: Project Virtua
projects.description: A library for creating virtual reality applications on the original Oculus DK1 with a Microsoft Kinect 1.0 sensor. More information can be found at projectvirtua.com. This was created for my Capstone project for my Computer Science degree at Christopher Newport University.

projects.name: Breakout Clone
projects.description: A Breakout clone I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML. Unfortunately the video of this was lost to time.

projects.name: Breakin
projects.description: A second Breakout clone I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Santa's Sleigh Ride
projects.description: A holiday themed game I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML. Unfortunately the video of this was lost to time.

projects.name: Maze Game
projects.description: A simple RPG maze game I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Jumper
projects.description: A simple 2D platformer game I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Ping
projects.description: A simple pong clone I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Super Ninja Bears and Fruit Fun Time
projects.description: A full-fledged 2D platformer I made for my Twitch game development livestream. It was built in 48 hours for an online game jam. The game came in 6th place out of 34 games submitted for the game jam. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Invaded
projects.description: A Space Invaders clone I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Role Call
projects.description: A simple RPG game I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Box2D and SFML Demo
projects.description: A simple demo project of how to use Box2D and SFML together.

projects.name: Grassman
projects.description: A PacMan-esque clone I made for my Twitch game development livestream. Built using C++ and SFML.

projects.name: Snake Clone
projects.description: A simple clone of Snake. Built as an example of how to do so in C#.

projects.name: Rock, Paper, Scissors, Lizard, Spock DS
projects.description: A version of Rock, Paper, Scissors, Lizard Spock for the Nintendo DS. The game is based off of the one of the same name in the TV show "The Big Bang Theory"

projects.name: IRC Client
projects.description: A very simple IRC Client, built from the ground up in C# (i.e.: No external libraries). Learned how to implement the IRC protocol from scratch.

projects.name: CNU ACM CTF Hacks - 2014
projects.description: This was the repository of websites with vulnerabilities used in our Capture the Flag (CTF) competition with the Christopher Newport University (CNU) Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) chapter in 2014. Competitors had to exploit the code in this repository.
